constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 148 (Wednesday, September 14, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. KUSTER:
H.R. 8828.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the United States
Constitution, the Taxing and Spending Clause: ``The Congress
shall have Power To lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts
and Excises, to pay the Debts and provide for the common
Defense and general Welfare of the United States . . .''
[Page H7842]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

title: FDA Ethics Act of 2022
